TaskDescription.Summary: Waiting for a object to appear on the screen
TaskDescription.Detail: Access Youtube with the Chrome browser and click '채널 탐색' on the Youtube page menu. Activities such as IsExist and WaitAppear in the App library can be used to check if a specific object exists on the screen, wait until it appears on the screen, and then scroll or click the mouse.

Assist.value: Execute Chrome.exe through the command.
Enter the command of the app to run as 'chrome'.
You can enter the URL to go to in chrome as the launch argument. Enter 'www.youtube.com'.
After launching Chrome, you can enter the name of the app to check whether it is running or not. Enter null to not check.
Click the Run button to open the Chrome browser and check if the Youtube site is displayed.
Check whether a particular object exists on the screen. You can determine whether the left menu is displayed on the Youtube page.
You can double-click a highlighted box to specify an object. On the Youtube page executed in the previous step, click the '홈' letter at the top of the left menu to specify the object.

Enter a variable to store the results of the examination to see if the object exists on the screen. Please enter this.IsExist. If the object exists on the screen, the true value is stored in this.IsExist, and if it does not exist, the false value is stored.
You can specify actions to be performed only if certain conditions are met.

If the object does not exist on the screen in the preceding step, a false is stored in this.IsExist variable. Enter this.IsExist == false in the Condition attribute value. Perform the next step only when the object does not exist on the screen, and skip the next step if the object exists on the screen.
If the menu does not exist on the screen, select the menu icon to display the menu on the screen.
You can double-click a highlighted box to specify an object. Select the menu icon in the upper left corner of the Youtube page.
Click the Run button to see if you are clicking the menu icon in the upper left corner.
Wait for the '홈' object to appear on the screen for mouse scrolling.

You can assign an object by double-clicking on the highlighted box. In the Youtube page executed in the previous step, click the home letter at the top of the left menu to designate an object. (When designating an object, you need to specify a narrow area containing only the letters '홈' rather than a wide area containing '홈' to increase accuracy.)
Scroll the mouse away from the '홈' object.
You can specify the number of times to scroll up or down. You can type 2 to scroll down the mouse twice.

You can assign an object by double-clicking on the highlighted box. Specify the object by clicking on the '홈' letter that you waited for in the previous step to appear on the screen. (When designating an object, you need to specify a narrow area containing only the letters '홈' rather than a wide area containing 'Home' to increase accuracy.)
Click the Run button to check if the mouse scrolls twice from '홈'.
Wait for the '채널 탐색' object to appear on the screen to click.

You can assign an object by double-clicking on the highlighted box. In the left menu of the Youtube page executed in the previous step, click the '채널 탐색' text to specify the object. (When specifying an object, you should specify a narrow area containing only the words '채널 탐색' rather than a wide area containing '채널 탐색' to increase accuracy.)
Find the '채널 탐색' object and click on it.

You can assign an object by double-clicking on the highlighted box. Specify the object by clicking on the '채널 탐색' text that you waited for in the previous step to appear on the screen. (When specifying an object, you should specify a narrow area containing only the words '채널 탐색' rather than a wide area containing '채널 탐색' to increase accuracy.)
Make sure you click the Run button to perform a '채널 탐색' click.
